What is AxisUI?

AxisUI is a modern, lightweight CSS framework built with Sass that provides a comprehensive set of utility classes and pre-built components for rapid web development. Designed with flexibility and performance in mind, it offers a perfect balance between utility-first and component-based approaches.

Key Features: Responsive grid system, utility classes, dark mode support, and customizable components.

Installation

Get started with AxisUI by including it in your project via CDN or by installing it through npm.

Via CDN

<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.axisui.com/v1/axis-ui.css">

Via NPM

npm install axisui

Quick Start

Create your first page with AxisUI in just a few steps:

  1. Include the AxisUI CSS file in your HTML head
  2. Add the axis-ui class to your body or container
  3. Start using utility classes and components
<body class="axis-ui">
    <div class="container">
        <h1 class="text-3xl fw-bold text-blue">Hello AxisUI!</h1>
        <button class="btn btn-primary">Click Me</button>
    </div>
</body>

Customization

AxisUI is built with Sass, making it easy to customize colors, spacing, breakpoints, and more. Simply override the default variables before importing AxisUI: 

// your-custom-styles.scss
$ax-primary-color: #ff6b6b;
$ax-spacing-base: 1rem;

@import 'axisui/axis-ui';
